abstract: Flora Project, three-year endeavor, is collaboration of Central Park Conservancy, New York Botanical Garden and New York City's parks department; mission of project, lead by Daniel Atha and adjunct Prof Regina V Alvarez of Queensborough Community College, is to document and collect every naturally occurring plant in Central Park.
lead_paragraph: The Flora Project has documented 200 species of plants in the park, discovering some that were previously not known to grow there.

headline.main: A Mission to Catalog Hidden Life in Central Park
headline.print_headline: Botany Team Is on a Mission to Discover Hidden Life in a Most Public Space

snippet: The Flora Project has documented 200 species of plants in the park, discovering some that were previously not known to grow there.
